intro: Hieracium basiglyphum, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, hairy stems. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium basiglyphum is known for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions, making it a notable species in high-altitude ecosystems.
